attributes.text:
This class is the single point to access all settings that may be different in different environments. This contains e.g. the browser name, engine version but also qooxdoo or application specific settings.

It’s public API can be found in its four main methods. One pair of methods are used to check the synchronous values of the environment. The other pair is used for asynchronous checks.

The most used method should be {@link #get} which is used to return the current value for a given environment check.

All qx settings can be changed via the generator’s config. See the manual for more details about the environment key in the config. As you can see from the methods API, there is no way to override an existing key. So if you need to change a qx setting, you have to use the generator to do so.

The following table shows all checks which could be used. If you are interessted in more details, check the reference to the implementation of each check. Plese do not use these check implementation directly due to the missing caching feature the Environment class offers.

Synchronous checks

Key

Type

Example

Details

Asynchronous checks
html.dataurlBooleantrue {@link qx.bom.client.Html#getDataUrl}
Map containing the synchronous check functions.
Map containing the asynchronous check functions.
Internal cache for all checks.
The value which should be returned.
Internal helper which creates a function retuning the given value.
A function which could be used by a test.
Import checks from global qx.$$environment into the Environment class.
Checks the URL for environment settings and imports these into the Environment class.
The key to search for in the values.
A map containing some keys.

Internal helper which tries to pick the given key from the given values map. If that key is not found, it tries to use a key named “default”. If there is also no default key, it prints out a warning and returns undefined.
The value stored as values[key] usually.
Initializer for the checks which are available on runtime.
Initializer for the default values of the framework settings.
The key for the check e.g. html.featurexyz.
It could be either a function or a simple value. The function should be responsible for the check and should return the result of the check.
Add a check to the environment class. If there is already a check added for the given key, the add will be ignored.
The key of the check e.g. html.featureabc
A function which should check for a specific environment setting in an asynchronous way. The method should take two arguments. First one is the callback and the second one is the context.
Adds an asynchronous check to the environment. If there is already a check added for the given key, the add will be ignored.
The name of the check you want to query.

The default accessor for the checks. It returns the value the current environment has for the given key. The key could be something like “qx.debug”, “css.textoverflow” or “io.ssl”. A complete list of checks can be found in the class comment of this class.

Please keep in mind that the result is cached. If you want to run the check function again in case something could have been changed, take a look at the {@link #invalidateCacheKey} function.
The key of the asynchronous check.
The function to call as soon as the check is done. The function should have one argument which is the result of the check.
The context to use when invoking the callback.
Invokes the callback as soon as the check has been done. If no check could be found, a warning will be printed.
The key of the check.
Invalidates the cache for the given key.
The name of the check the select depends on.
A map containing the values which should be returned in any case. The “default” key could be used as a catch all statement.
Returns the proper value dependent on the check for the given key.
The value which is stored in the map for the given check of the key.
The key for the async check.

A map containing functions. The map keys should contain all possibilities which could be returned by the given check key. The “default” key could be used as a catch all statement. The called function will get one parameter, the result of the query.
The context which should be used when calling the method in the values map.
Selects the proper function dependent on the asynchronous check.
the check key.
Internal helper for the generator to flag that this block contains the dependency for the given check key.
Always true
